description: United Nations recovery framework in support of Government of India for a post-tsunami rehabilitation and reconstruction programme

subproject.description: Continued commitment to social equity issues in UNTRS programmes and initiatives and the general post tsunami R & R activities
subproject.title: Post Tusnami Recovery-UN-Coord

subproject.corporate outcome: Development plans and programmes integrate environmentally sustainable solutions in a manner that promotes poverty reduction, MDG achievement and low-emission climate-resilient development
subproject.description: Plans for the long-term conservation of unique coastal eco-systems of tsunami affected areas in mainland southern India (Tsunami affected states and UT) for their environmental services are developed by end 2008.
subproject.title: Post Tsunami Recov.Healthy Env

subproject.corporate outcome: National and local institutions have the capacities to reduce the impact of disasters, especially climate change related disasters, on vulnerable communities
subproject.description:
The development stakeholders in Tamil nadu and Kerala with a special emphasis on Department of Fisheries Tamil nadu have evidence-based  inputs to the policy by September 2008,  to strategically ensure sustainable livelihoods for coastal marginal fisher folk  in tsunami affected areas,  through Fisheries co management models, models and strategies for enhancing and diversifying  fisheries livelihoods.

Target women groups and youth in the tsunami affected areas of Kanyakumari and Kollam districts have increased their incomes by gaining employment in Non-Fishing sector by the end of 2008
subproject.title: Post Tsunami Rebldg Livelihood

title: United Nations post-tsunami Recovery Framework
